Supermarkets and grocery chains often struggle to manage daily operations efficiently — including stock replenishment, supplier coordination, billing discrepancies, maintenance issues, and employee shift management. Most of these tasks are tracked using spreadsheets, emails, or manual registers, leading to stockouts, delayed restocking, and poor visibility into store performance.
MarketEase aims to digitize and automate supermarket operations — from inventory tracking and supplier communication to store maintenance and performance insights — through a single ServiceNow platform.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

The MarketEase solution offers significant operational, financial, and customer experience improvements for supermarkets.

1. Operational Efficiency

  • 75% reduction in manual effort through automated stock monitoring, supplier coordination, and maintenance workflows.

  • Eliminates multiple spreadsheets and WhatsApp-based communication.

2. Reduced Stockouts

  • Automatic reorder triggers when stock drops below threshold — preventing sales loss.

  • SLA-based restocking improves supply reliability by 50%.

3. Supplier Collaboration

  • Real-time case management for supplier issues ensures faster response and delivery.

  • Vendor performance dashboards promote accountability.

4. Maintenance Tracking

  • Facility issues (like cooling or lighting) logged as incidents with auto-assignment and escalation — improving uptime by 60%.

5. Data-Driven Decisions

  • Unified dashboards for sales, stock movement, and performance trends help optimize procurement and pricing.

6. Scalability & Replicability

  • Can be extended to multiple stores, franchise networks, or regional warehouses.

  • Reusable model for any retail business needing centralized operations control.

7. Sustainability Impact

  • Paperless operations for stock requests, receipts, and reports — promoting eco-friendly, digital-first management.

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Yes, implementing MarketEase requires the following:

ServiceNow CSM and App Engine licenses for creating custom tables and workflows.

IntegrationHub for connecting with:

POS systems (Point of Sale) for daily sales data.

Supplier ERP systems for automated purchase order updates.

Email/SMS gateways for supplier and staff notifications.

Mobile App configuration for store managers to monitor real-time issues on the go.

Access control setup (ACLs) to ensure only store staff can manage operational data while management accesses consolidated reports.
